title: OneDriveCommands Removal - CLI Cleanup
details:
TASK: Remove OneDriveCommands and related tests from the CLI application, as OneDrive API access will be handled only through the API layer.

COMPLETED ACTIONS:
1. **Removed Files**:
   - d:\source\notebook-automation\src\c-sharp\NotebookAutomation.Cli\Commands\OneDriveCommands.cs
   - d:\source\notebook-automation\src\c-sharp\NotebookAutomation.Cli.Tests\Commands\OneDriveCommandsTests.cs

2. **Updated Program.cs**:
   - Removed OneDriveCommands instantiation and registration lines:
     ```csharp
     var oneDriveCommands = new OneDriveCommands(loggerFactory.CreateLogger<OneDriveCommands>());
     oneDriveCommands.Register(rootCommand, configOption, debugOption, verboseOption, dryRunOption);
     ```

3. **Verification**:
   - ✅ Solution builds successfully with no compilation errors
   - ✅ All tests pass (600 total: 597 succeeded, 3 skipped, 0 failed)
   - ✅ Help output no longer shows "onedrive" command
   - ✅ No remaining references to OneDriveCommands in active code

IMPACT:
- CLI help now shows 6 commands instead of 7 (removed "onedrive" command)
- Application maintains all other functionality
- OneDrive integration will be handled through API endpoints instead of CLI commands
- Clean separation of concerns between CLI and API layers

COMMANDS NOW AVAILABLE IN CLI:
- tag (Tag management commands)
- vault (Vault management commands) 
- video-notes (Video notes and metadata commands)
- pdf-notes (PDF notes and metadata commands)
- generate-markdown (Generate markdown from HTML, TXT, and EPUB sources)
- config (Configuration management commands)

This change aligns with the architectural decision to access OneDrive functionality through the API layer rather than direct CLI commands.
